attributes.action: Make compassionate leave compulsory and paid
attributes.background: Make compassionate leave for close family members (parents, children, siblings, partners, in-laws and grandparents) compulsory for companies to recognize, and for the leave to be paid so the surviving family member is not left shortpaid due to the relatives death.
attributes.additional_details:
In May 2017, both of my grandfathers passed away. My company did not grant compassionate leave either time, giving me the only option to take it as unpaid sick leave. This pushed me into financial difficulty which I have yet to come out of, playing catch up each month. 

My cousin had the same situation, having to take annual leave on the day of our grandfathers death.

Family members dying is hard enough to deal with emotionally, the worker should not be affected financially as well.

attributes.action: Ban the cruel Glue traps in which Songbirds Kittens & Hedgehogs starve to death.
attributes.background: Glue traps don't just trap rats and mice, they indiscriminately catch any creature which has the misfortune to come into contact with them sentencing them to a lingering death in agony, until they die from starvation. The makers recommend disposing of the live, trapped victim in household waste.
attributes.additional_details:
Glue Traps are already banned Ireland and New Zealand.
Humane Society International have disturbing videos of all kinds of stuck creatures, trying to free themselves from glue traps which cause "hideous and even illegal cruelty” traps which 68 per cent of the British public would support banning. This can be seen at www.hsi.org
 
PETA, People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals, have fought these since they first went on sale. See www.peta.org/issues/wildlife/wildlife-factsheets/glue-traps

attributes.action: Guarantee equal or better funding for scientific research in the UK after Brexit
attributes.background: We rely heavily on EU research funding ~€1.2 billion p.a. from Horizon 2020, there is no clear plan on how this will be replaced after Brexit. I ask that the future funding is guaranteed and extra UK grants are made that at least match or better the input from Horizon 2020 to UK HE institutions.
attributes.additional_details:
At time of writing, there is no deal for joint EU-UK research funding after Brexit. The UK will not have access to the same amount of funding and hundreds of top level research jobs will be lost due to the shortfall, unless the UK government increases domestic research budgets. https://ec.europa.eu/unitedkingdom/news/uk-institutions-and-researchers-top-recipients-eu-innovation-funding_en

UK HE institutes received ~€1.2 billion in 2015 http://ec.europa.eu/budget/figures/interactive/index_en.cfm

attributes.action: Make it the law for children's feelings and wishes to be heard in family court
attributes.background: I want it to be the law that children can voice what they want to happen in family court, in person, by a voice recorded clip to be played or a letter to be read by the judge. Too many children are not being heard, it time to give them a voice.

attributes.action: Educate children in schools regarding fellow pupils' illnesses and their effects
attributes.background:
Over the past 9 years of supporting sick and disabled children and running Matts Mission Children's Charity over 6 years, we sadly come into contact with many families with sick children that have lost hair or are disabled and are bullied in school.

A subject needs to be put in place to support.
attributes.additional_details: Children all over the world are being diagnosed with a serious illness every day, they go through so much, treatment for an illness such as cancer makes the child's hair fall out. Sadly many children in schools including higher education schools are being called names, spat on, laughed at, wigs pulled off there head. It is getting out of control, it is time these children understood the damage they are causing to the confidence of these sick children. Schools need to help to stop this happening.

attributes.action: Introduce retaining 5% of price, until remedial work on new homes is completed.
attributes.background: Issues reported in the first two years are the responsibility of the house builder, followed by a further eight years of (structural) NHBC insurance cover.  However, from our experience the rectification of problems are being extended beyond the warranty period and some issues are being refused.
attributes.additional_details: Realistically homes cannot be perfect.  However a timely redress for repairs is now required. Therefore, retaining 5% of the purchase price of the property should prompt builders to rectify concerns without delays. Subsequently, this would allow customers not to feel unhappy and stressed in their new homes.

attributes.action: Make every workplace and school complete a mandatory yearly CPR training day.
attributes.background: Many people don't know how to perform a life saving procedure (CPR) due to no fault of their own, but due to their school or work areas not providing this training. I believe more lives will be saved if CPR training is an mandatory training session. I know many people would appreciate this training.

attributes.action: On Armistice Day 2018, light beacons across the country as a sign of Remembrance
attributes.background:
This year marks the centenary of the end of the Great War.
As a mark of respect to all The Brave who made the ultimate sacrifice and gave their lives for their country, the Government should light Beacons across the country on Armistice Day (November 11th) 2018.

attributes.action: Stop Anti-abortion Life charity from getting £250k from from UK tampon tax.
attributes.background: The government has confirmed that it is to award a quarter of a million pounds from an unpopular levy on women’s sanitary products to an anti-abortion organisation, despite objections from women’s groups and MPs.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/oct/28/anti-abortion-life-charity-will-get--tampon-tax-funds

attributes.action: Make domestic abusers sign a register
attributes.background: Domestic abuse will affect 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men in their lifetime and leads to, on average, two women being murdered each week and 30 men per year. By getting domestic abusers to sign a register, this could at least warn people before they decide to continue in a relationship with someone.

attributes.action: Ban all trade of Ivory in the UK with NO exceptions!
attributes.background: Elephants’ biggest threat is the trade in their ivory tusks. The UK has become the world’s leading exporter in ivory in recent years. The newly proposed ban contains exceptions, including musical Instruments and items of "cultural importance". The ban should be TOTAL, with no exceptions.
attributes.additional_details: For more information search for "The Truth Behind Your Ivory Trinkets" on YouTube. This video shows the brutal process by which ivory is harvested and contains more information about the ivory trade. Please watch.

attributes.action: Abolish Mobile Speed Cameras
attributes.background: The use of mobile speed cameras is increasing generating masses of revenue for local authorities. Current tactics used to target drivers on the roads when going about their daily business is wrong, has a negative impact on lives and contributes only a small percentage to road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
These days it’s easy to speed in modern cars & the police know it so when traveling to work one day in a safe manner they’ll be waiting for you tucked in on some layby.

Law abiding citizens caught by these mobile speed traps feel they’ve been deliberately targeted & criminalised by the organisation set out to protect is in for gain. Millions of drivers fined for speeding over the years have seen nothing in return and whilst this continues what improvements have we seen from all these fines?

attributes.action: All Government forms, publications in English or English/Welsh languages only.
attributes.background:
In 2014 the public sector spent 140 million on translation services; 2017 will be considerably more.
Local councils spent at least £25m; the police £21m; the courts system spent more than £10m without accounting for the cost of legal aid; and the NHS – a conservative estimate was £55m.
attributes.additional_details:
The Human Rights Act only requires translation if someone is arrested or charged with a criminal offence.

There are far too many foreign nationals settled in the UK long term that do not or refuse to integrate fully into our society by not learning to read and write in our native languages.

Translating is not only expensive it is doing harm because it reinforces the language barrier which separates communities and hinders integration.

attributes.action: Bring HMP Service in line with other public services and improve the uniform
attributes.background: The current uniform for HM Prison service is out of date and unpractical. Staff working within prisons are required to wear neckties and white shirts when other public services like the police are not, even though they face the public on a daily basis. Polo shirts are smarter and more practical.
attributes.additional_details: The current rules regarding the uniform are fluid and are at the discretion of establishment Governors, some staff are not required to wear ties throughout the summer but must wear them for winter periods. The ties offer no protection from the cold and do not improve the working practice of staff, in fact can be described as a barrier between staff and prisoners. The money saved on producing white shirts and ties could easily be used to improve rehabilitation of offenders.

attributes.action: A life sentence should mean there can never be the chance of parole.
attributes.background: A life sentence should mean just that. There should be no chance of parole. The sentencing guidelines need to be changed so that life means life. Whole life tariffs for the most heinous crimes should be mandatory. Life should mean Life.

attributes.action: Produce statutory guidance on how universities should support Dyslexic students.
attributes.background: Dyslexics learn differently. They are put at a disadvantage in today's educational system. Dyslexics should be given the same opportunity to reach their potential.
attributes.additional_details: I am dyslexic. I was lucky enough to receive a lot of support throughout my education. However, when I started university, my dyslexia became more apparent. I found it very difficult to learn from the teaching style. Moreover, the majority of my work was not marked in conjunction with my SPLD cover note. After speaking to my dyslexia help tutor, I learned that many lecturers do not believe in dyslexia. Therefore, the government should introduce statutory guidance to universities on how they can support dyslexic students. For example, by recommending compulsory seminars/training for staff.

attributes.action: Allow women to carry pepper sprays for self defence.
attributes.background:
It's unfortunate that we we are witnessing the rise of crime especially in the last year. It is also common sense to acknowledge that women are in a higher risk to be victims of all crimes especially ones of sexual nature.
As crime is skyrocketing protecting ourselves is an obligation.
attributes.additional_details: The Office of National Statistics state that the total number of crimes reported by police arose by 10% between April 2016 and March 2017 -a total of almost 5 million crimes. Violent crimes arose by 18%, robberies by 16%, sex offences by 14% and knife crimes by 20%. Women are more likely to experience all kind of violence and 5 times as likely to experience sexual attacks.The number of rapes recorded by police has doubled in the last 4 years. The figures are worrying and women feel insecure.

attributes.action: Create a bank holiday to celebrate the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle
attributes.background: Today a spokesperson for the Prime Minister stated there was no intention of holding a bank holiday. People should be allowed to rejoice in the marriage of Prince Harry & Meghan Markle. There is precedent for this. A bank holiday was granted for the marriage of The Duke & Duchess of Cambridge.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age to 21
attributes.background: I feel as everything else is going up like smoking/drinking and this shouldn't be any different also it would reduce voting fraud.

attributes.action: Halt Taunton Deane District Council taking over West Somerset District Council.
attributes.background: The obliteration of West Somerset Council will reduce electoral its representation, will centralise services in the more prosperous and more urbanised Taunton Deane and distance people in West Somerset from the delivery of services by making those delivering the services less accountable.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposed merger was based on a deficit accumulated by West Somerset. The deficit, that is forecast to drop dramatically, is not surprising given West Somerset's relative deprivation and the unfair distribution of the rural grant that pays a city like Bristol more per head in than the deeply rural and under populated West Somerset.

Construction of Hinkley C nuclear power station and the government's policy of local councils retaining business rates will change the fortunes of West Somerset.

attributes.action: Require all MLM schemes to publish & display annual income disclosures.
attributes.background: 99.7% of people who pay to join a multi-level marketing scheme lose money. Not all MLM schemes provide an income disclosure statement that includes ALL participants who've joined. This needs to be a requirement so people can make an informed decision before paying to join.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.statisticbrain.com/mlm-direct-selling-statistics/

attributes.action: To not spend £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust
attributes.background:
Why are we spending £50m of public money on a memorial to the Holocaust? Great Britain didn't carry out this atrocity but spent years fighting at war because of it. 
Surely this is tribute enough? 
Spend our money on more pressing matters at home , e.g.  NHS etc.

attributes.action: Illegal dog fighting - raise the period of imprisonment.
attributes.background: Although illegal, dog fighting and baiting; using dogs and cats is still going on.The maximum sentence for offenders is six months in prison and/or an unlimited fine, but campaigners want it to be raised to up to 3 years.
attributes.additional_details: The Animal Welfare Act 2006  has introduced an important and new concept for pet owners and those responsible for domestic animals. Dog fighting is still going on and proactive action needs to be taken to prevent such crimes, not just reactive action often when animals have been so cruelly killed.

attributes.action: Make specialist training a requirement for licensing of zoos with exotic animals
attributes.background: Currently, there are no legal requirements for a person to have gained any formal training to be awarded a licence for a zoo or sanctuary that contains exotic animals. Through the lack of expertise and knowledge this leads to the maltreatment of animals in captivity.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of specialist training leads to the maltreatment and fatality of exotic animals and risk to both public and staff. The recent death of two large cats - one which was asphyxiated during incompetent handling and the other which escaped and was euthanised when deemed to be a threat to the public - could have been avoided had appropriate training been required of the operators. Other cases of neglect of exotic animals at licensed establishments have been made public, as have deaths of handlers

attributes.action: Provide dedicated child bereavement teams to families after the death of a child
attributes.background:
After losing 2 children within 2 1/2 years my family was offered no support either during or after our hospital stay. We left the hospital with a pamphlet, a box and a broken heart.
Families are left to scour google for hours in the hope of finding support and it's just not good enough.
attributes.additional_details:
Today 17 babies will die, and these families wont have a clue where to turn as they begin their grieving process.
It is often left down to each family to source their own support at a time when they're at their most emotionally vulnerable.
There should be dedicated teams of professionals who can support families before, during and after the loss of their child for as long as necessary and it should be mandatory that these teams are in place and active in each case as soon as the need arises.

attributes.action: Make closed book GCSE English Literature OPTIONAL for 16 year olds in the UK
attributes.background:
Year 11 students face the huge task of taking a compulsory exam in GCSE English Literature. This is a closed book exam in which the study and  memorisation of quotes is essential . 
Surely this is an unnecessary waste of resources when there is already a compulsory examination in English Langauge.
attributes.additional_details:
The NSPCC reports a surge in the number of young people seeking help through the Childline support service specifically as a result of exam stress. 

We are concerned that the new style English Literature exam is inaccessible to students where poor language and literary skills prevail; its compulsory nature breeds unprecedented levels of stress.

Ministers wishing to tackle student mental health issues,  should consider the impact of their English Literature Exam policy; make it optional study .

attributes.action: Make all fireworks silent in Britain
attributes.background: We all know that fireworks terrify wildlife and can cause catastrophic consequences to our animals, not only they suffer but those with psychological issues with noise can become traumatised at this time of year (PTSD etc). Britain can use this compassion to respect our soldiers and animals

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis oil for medicinal usage.
attributes.background:
Cannabis Oil is one of the oldest medicines known to Man. There has been numerous studies completed proving that cannabis oil can assist treating epilepsy, insomnia and even treat people suffering from cancer. 

Cannabidiol (CBD) can be developed for use with low THC content therefor no high...
attributes.additional_details:
Scientists are rapidly discovering more and more about the rather amazing abilities of the cannabinoids found in the cannabis plant. Most of them have shown therapeutic value, as have the terpenes, which give the plant its distinct odors. There are over 125 terpenes and over 80 cannabinoids in cannabis and each strain has its own unique blend that create its distinct effects. 
CBD also has the effect of reducing the undesirable effects of high-THC cannabis, such as anxiety and paranoia.

attributes.action: Reduce the overseas aid to 0.2% of GNI.
attributes.background: We should reduce our overseas aid budget of 0.7% of (GNI) to 0.2% of GNI to come in-line with other European Countries and America. Based on the £12b budget of 2015 this would leave us with an additional £8b which should be immediately allocated to the NHS and social care budgets.
attributes.additional_details: We also ask that all overseas aid should be means tested before any Country is allocated any money at all. This will stop the waste of hundreds of millions that goes to Countries with space programs for example or are fighting wars with their neighbours and their own people.

attributes.action: Ban the Government P.R.N. scheme - For Plastic Recycling export profits.
attributes.background: The P.R.N. Is a scheme set up by the UK Government, for recycling exporters to make huge profits. Sadly, this scheme allows tonnes of unrecyclable/hazardous plastics to be shipped overseas. Which ends up polluting the environment. We could deal with our plastics in the UK, if the PRN was scrapped.
attributes.additional_details:
This would in turn, create many jobs here in th UK.
Would ensure we know 100% what happens with our recycling / plastics. 
Would help reduce wrecking the planet and killing wildlife. 

If you need proof. Check out 'Ocean Rescue: Dirty Business' on Sky Atlantic!

attributes.action: Delay the sale of RBS until the taxpayer has made a profit on the bailout
attributes.background: The government bought a 72% stake in RBS after the Financial crisis and has kept it in public ownership whilst it was posting losses. This year it finally posted a healthy profit, so the Tories have decided to sell it. We will be making a £26 billion loss on this purchase.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ft.com/content/555bfe08-cf99-11e7-9dbb-291a884dd8c6

attributes.action: Government to provide mental health screening for all new fathers.
attributes.background: While new mothers have screening for their mental health, unfortunately fathers who also have a history if depression do not at present. With all recent research on Fathers we must provide an assessment for all parents as the biggest killer in men under fifty in the UK is SUICIDE.

attributes.action: Stop charging VAT on vet treatments/animal medicinces
attributes.background: So it's just cost me £278 to have a cut stitched, of this £46 was VAT, as this is for medical treatment to animals, why do we have to pay VAT, imagine how much would be charged on a more complicated operation, £20 in every £100

attributes.action: Allow Cannabis Patches to be prescribed on the NHS for Chronic Pain conditions
attributes.background: Cannabis Patches should be prescribed on the NHS. It’s safer and cheaper than drugs currently used such as Morphine and Fentanyl.
attributes.additional_details:
I have many Chronic Pain conditions. I have been taking controlled drugs for over 12 years such as Morphine, Fentanyl, Oramorph and Tramadol ALL this could be avoided if I could have ONE Cannabis patch.  What I take is far more addictive and costs much more than a Cannabis Patch. It’s time we had Cannabis Patches made available on the NHS.
https://fibromyalgianewstoday.com/2017/06/23/first-cannabinoid-based-patch-for-fibromyalgia-other-chronic-pain-is-ready-for-release/

attributes.action: Fund a veterans' bus pass for all veterans
attributes.background: The Government should demonstrate its gratitude for what all the Veterans have done for this Country so this is why I would like to start this petition.

attributes.action: Extend the 16-19 transport bursary to pupils placed in an Independent setting.
attributes.background: This bursary is supposed to enable pupils from families on a low income to access education and/ or training by meeting transport costs. The eligibility assumes pupils are not in Independent settings, but local authorities who cannot provide for some with additional needs often use such placements.
attributes.additional_details: The result is that families on a low income with children who have additional needs are financially discriminated against. Often the reason many families with a child who has additional needs are on a low income is due to the care needs of that child.

attributes.action: When a defendant makes a plea in a sexual case, the jury should be made aware
attributes.background: Three girls were raped. When the case went to Crown Court, the rapist offered to plead guilty saying that he used his fingers and not his private part. The girls rejected the plea and, to the horror of all 13 witnesses, he was found not guilty. The jury should have known he offered a guilty plea.
attributes.additional_details: In future, when a defendant makes a plea in a case of sexual violence, the jury should be told

attributes.action: Increase funding to Children's Mental Health services in the UK.
attributes.background: In 2015, the government pledged an extra £1.4 billion over five years to “transform” CAMHS (Children and Adolescent Mental Health Services). CCGs (Clinical Comission Groups) used this money for other priorities, or something completely different. Children's Mental Health Services need more funding.
attributes.additional_details: References: https://youngminds.org.uk/about-us/media-centre/press-releases/children-s-mental-health-funding-not-going-where-it-should-be/

attributes.action: Put pressure on Israel to free the Palestinian 16 year old teenager Ahed Tamimi
attributes.background: Ahed Tamimi, a prominent 16-year-old Palestinian activist, was reported to have been detained during a pre-dawn raid on her home by the Israeli army and border police in the occupied West Bank.
attributes.additional_details: Ahed's mother, Nariman, is also said to have been arrested on Tuesday afternoon during a visit to Ahed at an Israeli police station.

attributes.action: Help stop the government plans to decentralise ALL sexual violence funding.
attributes.background: At RASA Merseyside we are trying to #shinealight into the darkness of the hidden horrors of rape and sexual abuse. More individuals are coming forward and asking for support. Recently funding for sexual violence support services has remained constant or dropped.
attributes.additional_details: This plan in 2018/19 would be disastrous for many services, despite the evidence pointing to the problems this will cause for established services that rely on such funding for their core service delivery. It is likely there will be less support available for survivors, as decentralised funds are consumed by other priority local needs. We can already see a decrease in service levels and an increase in waiting times for support. We ask that the government urgently reconsider this proposed action.

attributes.action: Introduce domestic abuse awareness as part of life skills to the curriculum
attributes.background: On 21.01.2018 an innocent child lost her life to domestic abuse.  The term "domestic incident" was used, minimising the severity of domestic abuse, indicating that there is a lack of understanding of the complex cycle.  Without awareness of this crime, how are we able to protect our young people?
attributes.additional_details:
My name is Samantha Billingham and I am a survivor of domestic abuse.

It is easier to stop something happening in the first place than to repair the damage after it has happened and with mandatory awareness, we can do that.  The outcome of talking about domestic abuse will have a positive behaviour enabling our young people to deal effectively with the challenges that domestic abuse brings to life.

Awareness is powerful, it gives people choices, options, knowledge, which could just save a life.

attributes.action: Create a Devolved English Parliament
attributes.background: Scotland has the Scottish Parliament, Wales has the Welsh Assembly (soon to be Parliament) and Northern Ireland has the Northern Ireland Assembly. As the most populous country within the United Kingdom, England should also have a parliament to end the West Lothian Question.
attributes.additional_details: For too long England has had Scottish, Welsh, and Northern Irish MPs vote on matters that only affect England. It is time to have a devolved parliament to bring fairness and democracy to the region.

attributes.action: Introduce an Opt-Out Electoral Register (Automatic Voter Registration Bill)
attributes.background: TalkPolitics is calling for the electoral register to be operated on an 'opt-out' basis, rather than 'opt-in'. We are calling for all UK citizens to be automatically added to the electoral register before their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
We want to;

- Ensure the 6 million people missing from the register are included,

- Save time and money by using an automatic system, similar to the National Insurance system,

- Take down an unnecessary barrier to democracy,

- Ensure everyone has a voice.

For more information on how the policy could work, read our in-depth policy analysis here: https://talk-politics.com/policy-analysis-automatic-voter-registration/

attributes.action: Introduce a new Act of Parliament to protect freedom of religion and belief.
attributes.background: Freedom of religion and belief in the UK is under attack. It is time for a new generation to rise up and reclaim this great heritage of religious freedom and for the UK Parliament to pass a new Act affirming our religious freedom.
attributes.additional_details: The UK led the world in developing freedom of religion, and in spreading the idea of religious freedom around the world. Today, that heritage is being turned upside down and we are turning our backs on our history. We are seeing an increasingly intolerant secular humanism and anti-Christian prejudice, often called Christianophobia, in the UK. We need to tackle this violence and prejudice towards practising Christians in the UK.

attributes.action: Place a permanent ban on the UK production and import of plastic drinking straws
attributes.background: Plastic pollution is a global issue, with plastic now being found in all oceans. Wasteful single-use items such as drinking straws are at the forefront of the problem. Every plastic straw ever made still exists in some form and they are consistently in the top ten of items found during beach cleans.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic straws are a big part of the global problem of unnecessary items ending up in the ocean, harming wildlife and entering the food chain. Eco friendly alternatives are available and there's no excuse for not using them.

http://www.plasticpollutioncoalition.org/pft/2017/1/3/the-problem-of-plastic-straws-and-how-each-of-us-can-make-a-difference

This petition demands that the British Government put planet before profit and permanently ban the UK production and import of plastic straws.

attributes.action: Let mothers be named on marriage certificates
attributes.background:
Currently marriage certificates only allow the fathers name on them and not mothers.

This petition aims to bring the marriage certificate into the 21st century.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to print information of a death U'18 without parental consent.
attributes.background: Michael, 17 years old, took his own life. Yet in the coroners inquest the press were allowed to hear every detail and print their own interpretation of the events and outcome of the inquest. Although in their article it was miss worded and irrelevant. Causing further grief to the family.
attributes.additional_details: This caused more grief for the family, with the press printing irrelevant information leading up to the events. It was confirmed by the coroner that Michael Nicholas, 17, took his own life on his own accord under no other influence. Although substances were found in the body. The press released information to make the public and readers think otherwise with their unneeded wording and wrong information. Due to their own take on events an article was released to the public and Mikey's friends and family.

attributes.action: Ask Parliament to debate the Basic Income
attributes.background: Britain is the 6th richest country on earth, yet 1/3rd of British children live in poverty. 3.8 million Brits in work live in poverty. A majority of people live paycheck to paycheck. The botched rollout of universal credits made matters worse. It's time for parliament to debate the basic income.
attributes.additional_details:
In the face of these devastating facts, many people have argued that giving everyone a small, monthly sum of money to cover their basic needs, without any work requirement, would significantly salvage the situation. This is what's called a basic income.

All we ask is for parliament to put all the ideas that may help deal with the issues outlined above on the table. That is literally their job. It's what they get paid to do. Ask parliament to debate the basic income.

attributes.action: Fire Risk Assessments should be conducted by the Fire Service ONLY.
attributes.background: Following the Grenfell tower and other fires, it appears that Fire Risk Assessments can be done by anyone who has been on a 3-day training course. This is wrong. The Fire Service are more qualified than anyone. We should go back to the Fire Service issuing certificates.

attributes.action: Have a general election before summer term 2018
attributes.background: At this time of political uncertainty, Britain needs to have a clear leader and a strong party to back them up. At the moment, the country doesn’t have a party with a strong mandate or a certain one. I believe that we need a chance for all political parties to present to us their arguments.
attributes.additional_details: So that we can decided clearly and indecisively who runs The U.K. This last general election failed us. The Conservative party clearly Expected to win and didn’t present their side, and labour fought but didn’t give a clear plan for their brexit, however now that Labour, like the Conservatives, have clarified their brexit strategy we, the British people deserve to make a choice, to benefit is locally and nationally.
